name: Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add diced onion and minced garlic. Sauté until softened.
Add ground beef to the pan and cook until browned. Drain excess fat.
Stir in tomato sauce, salt, and black pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve the sauce over spaghetti and top with grated Parmesan cheese.
notes: Add a pinch of red pepper flakes for a spicy kick.

name: Caesar Salad
instructions: Wash and dry the romaine lettuce. Chop into bite-sized pieces.
In a large bowl, toss the lettuce with Caesar dressing.
Add croutons and grated Parmesan cheese. Mix gently to combine.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Serve immediately.
notes: For added protein, top with grilled chicken or shrimp.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, cream together the butter, white sugar, and brown sugar until smooth.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla extract.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. Mix until just combined.
Drop by spoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until edges are lightly browned. Cool on wire racks.
notes: For chewier cookies, chill the dough for 30 minutes before baking.
